name: Quail Park Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The short version: Awesome, great and you need to stay here. SUPER Comfortable, great value, near everything, great staff, GREAT! Amenities and you can't beat the location.
reviews.title: AMAZING!! Comfortable, an OASIS in the desert

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The long version:
reviews.title: A Cool Place

reviews.text: We were on a road trip and had just arrive from Yellowstone. The Quail Park Lodge was such an amazing place. The front office looks so cool. I love the bikes!! After being on the road driving 686 miles I was tired but I wanted to get on a bike and ride around the town. It was so much fun. The staff is very friendly and the lemonade at the entrance is refreshing!
reviews.title: Will stay again!

reviews.text: Oh I totally forgot you need to make some time to float in the pool in the middle of the day. I found the small pool to be so much fun and the sun hits you just right. Also take time to nap, sleep in or get to bed early because the beds are so comfortable. During our road trip the Quail Park Lodge had the most comfortable beds. I'm telling you I felt like I was a baby being cradled in my mothers arms again. No joke they are amazing!
reviews.title: Suprise find in Kanab

reviews.text: Also the best part about the bikes is that you can ride them to dinner, breakfast anywhere in town.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable

reviews.text: Four of us girlfriends stayed here while on a trip to hike and to see Best Friends animal Sanctuary. This motel was the greatest! We were greeted by our host with a glass of wine for each of us. Every morning there were scones, coffee and fruit free in the office lobby. Every afternoon we had "cocktail hour" in the little patio outside. Although we didn't have time to ride the bikes that were provided, or swim in the pool, we loved the three restaurants a short walk from QPL where we were able to enjoy some of the best vegetarian food we've ever had.
reviews.title: Charming motel with great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lodge is both small and clean. We spend little time in our rooms as our goal is to be in the hiking areas around town. Our requirements center on cleanliness and sleep quality- in this sense the lodge met all our needs at a fair price.
reviews.title: Friendly and small

reviews.text: This was my third stay at Quail Park and I have had a great experience each stay. It is close to Best Friends Animal Sanctuary (5 miles) and has rooms that are dog friendly (bring your own dog or have a stay over with a dog from Best Friends.)
reviews.title: Quail Park and Best Friends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Route 66 roadies would feel right at home at Quail Park. It has the flavor of the original Route 66 motor lodges but has been updated and is clean, comfortable and has a continental breakfast to get you on the road. Staff and management are excellent.
reviews.title: Great location, staff and bed.

reviews.text: I highly recommend this motor lodge.
reviews.title: BEWARE of the Cancellation Policy!!!!!!

reviews.text: This was a nice motel, rooms were better than average. The motel has a very nice feel and taste and the owner was very friendly and helpful. There are bicycles that you can use for no charge and roam the town. We decided to eat at the bistro called Mediterranean Table, a fun and friendly restaurant 5 minutes down the road. The beds are very good, and amenities as well. We paid 130 usd, which is quite a lot for a motel, regardless how good the room is. It is an expensive place, but it was enjoyable nonetheless. We felt very welcome.
reviews.title: Good friendly place but not cheap
Quaint stay
reviews.text: Nice room, comfortable beds, personable management. Breakfast scones were wonderful. Only complaint is it is on the main road and we had to run our ac/heater for white noise in the evening and early morning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here after reading recommendations on Trip Advisor and in Lonely Planet and we're glad we did. Spacious room very clean and comfortable, tastefully decorated, firm beds, working wi-fi, apparently well insulated, we slept soundly though close to route 89 (as almost everything is in Kanab). Management were friendly and helpful, the basic breakfast in the office was all we needed. Definitely a cut above level of basic motel, we would certainly stay again.
reviews.title: More than just a motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at the Lodge 13.-21.Sept.'12! We felt at home right from the start! Ladd (Manager/Owner?) and his Team are the BEST!! Always helpful&friendly as can be! We volunteered @Best Friends Animal Sanctuary the whole time! Booked a Petfriendly Room (#3 2queens) ahead just in case we would take a sleepover dog ;) ! The Room was great (super clean every single day), with everything you need in it! You don't wanne get out of bed once your in it ;)!!! So compfy&soft - heaven for me! (and DON'T forget to spray the Linen&Bed Spray it's MAGIC!)! Thanks Ladd!!! ;)) Breakfast is PERFECT - totally enough! We loved the world most famous "sloping deck" for early morning coffees&evening-sunset wine till watching stars above;) Even thou the Lodge is right at the main road connection to the National Parks you wonder how quiet it get's in the evenings/nights! try the bikes for a nice ride throu Kanab, it's fun ;) we didn't try the pool(too lazy or to busy!) - but it looked very welcoming&super clean!
reviews.title: ❤❤❤ We LOVE LOVE LOVE this Place ❤❤❤

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ladd "might know people"(hihihi) at "The Rocking V" he sure help you with reservation in the high season ;)))
reviews.title: Retro Cool

reviews.text: We stayed at the Quail Park Lodge before and after a hiking trip to the North Rim. Rooms are updated with terrifc decor and very comfortable. Friendly service at the desk, nice little complimentary breakfast and a great little patio off to the side overlooking the park next door. No problem with noise even though the Lodge is right off the main road. Close to restaurants, etc. Highly recommend the Lodge!
reviews.title: Excellent jumping off spot for the North Rim!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at QPL, perfect place for a GC North Rim stay. If you travelled with mom and dad in the 50's and 60's, you are gonna love this place. Take the quaint motor court style, dress it up with top shelf amenities and you have QPL. The retro metal chairs and table in front of each room are the gathering place around happy hour and again for breakfast....chatting up and down the sidewalk, sharing travel stories and howdy do's. Free wifi and free view of the mountains! People you meet there, are just like you.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night at the QPL while we toured the area around Kanab. When we first pulled up in our rental car, the QPL looked like an old 50s-60s style motel - complete with GKWs scurrying around, broken lamps and bathroom switches.
reviews.title: Looks are deceiving

reviews.text: But nothing could be further from the truth. We found the room was VERY clean and well maintained, with nice and clean linens and towels. The staff was very knowledgeable and helpful, even calling us before closing due to our late arrival, saying how we could get into our reserved room.
reviews.title: Great Experience, warm Welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd call the QPL first next time we are in Kanab!
reviews.title: Quaint retro motel in Kanab.

description: Wonderful roadside lodge with convenient location and incredible views of red hills and Kanab canyon. Underwent a renovation in Spring of 2010 and Winter 2012 with a return to the classic 'Route 66' motor lodge and today's updated amenities. Features: Plush beds that are triple-sheeted, down-like comforters, iPod/mp3 players, free bike rentals, microwaves and refrigerators, free Wi-Fi, bathrobes, complimentary continental breakfast, new outdoor swimming pool, sun deck and all rooms are non-smoking.
